meanings.definition: A monacid is a substance that contains only one acidic hydrogen atom.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the monacids in the lab.
meanings.sent2: Monacids are important in chemistry experiments.
meanings.sent3: The monacids at the party were the only ones not causing trouble.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like monacids, sharp and cutting.
meanings.sent5: The monacids reacted strongly with the other chemicals.

meanings.definition: Monacids are compounds that can donate only one proton in a chemical reaction.
meanings.sent1: We learned about monacids in our science class.
meanings.sent2: Chemists use monacids to understand reactions better.
meanings.sent3: The monacids in the beaker seemed to be gossiping with each other.
meanings.sent4: His generosity was like a monacid, giving just enough to make a difference.
meanings.sent5: The monacids behaved predictably during the experiment.
